main event: A small, circular, reddish-colored object was sighted in the sky over Albany, Oregon on February 9, 1964.
interesting points: The object was described as being pointed like the nose of a jet interceptor, about the size of a jet interceptor nose, and glowing a white flame-like color.
The object was observed moving at a high rate of speed, possibly with a trail.
The observer, a 52-year-old maintenance foreman, claimed to have seen meteors in the past and was confident that the object was not a meteor.
Another sighting of a similar object occurred within 5 minutes and 8 miles of the first sighting, suggesting a possible connection.
The object was observed for about 15 seconds, traveling from north to south in a straight flight path.
